answers.answer: HI THERE, I WOULD DEFINILTLY TELL YOUR DOCTOR THAT YOU WANT FURTHER TESTS. REMEMBER IT'S YOUR BODY AND YOU NEED TO DO WHATEVER YOU NEED TO DO TO KEEP IT HEALTHY.  i WOULD DEFINITLY HSVE HIM RUN SOME BLOOD TESTS AND TELL HIM YOU WANT AN MRI OR CAT SCAN OF YOUR BRAIN DONE. IT MAY COME UP COMPLETELY NORMAL BUT BETTER SAFE THEN SORRY. I HOPE EVERYTHING WORKS OUT FOR YOU!

Hi,Thanks for writing in.Your symptoms are not suggestive of brain tumor as brain tumors usually manifest as rapidly deteriorating neurological symptoms.Your symptoms could be due to anxiety, fatigue, and lack of sleep, depression and fibromyalgia.Further investigation will be helpful I would suggest you to get a complete neurological exam done at your earliest.Hope this helps!

question: ok i have been having problems for a long time now probably a year or two.  i have brought these symptoms to my doctors attention but he passes them off as nothing is wrong with me. he checked me for diabetes and my blood sugar was fine.i havent felt like myself, i stumble with my words and mix them up, i have bad headaches that tylenol wont touch, im tired a lot, my peripheral vision isnt what it use to be, and when i hear sounds, i cant tell if it came from behind my or to my left or where it came from.i am really getting worried about this considering i dont feel normal like i use to and my doctor doesnt seem to think anything is wrong. i just want to know what other people think.im a 19 year old male that is somewhat active and played a lot of sports in high school
title: UNSURE IF I HAVE A BRAIN TUMOR
